item.description:
由于公民不愿采用该国的新货币，移动支付服务正在蓬勃发展

。【原文：

Mobile money services are booming as citizens are reluctant to adopt the country’s new currency

】

item.title: 美国提出在打击中国芯片市场中实施更严格贸易规则的设想
item.description: 拜登政府对中国的芯片打压政策面临反弹，他已告知盟友，如果东京电子有限公司（Tokyo Electron Ltd.）和ASML Holding NV等公司继续向中国提供先进的半导体技术，拜登政府将考虑采取最严厉的贸易限制措施。【原文：The Biden administration, facing pushback to its chip crackdown on China, has told allies that it’s considering using the most severe trade restrictions available if companies such as Tokyo Electron Ltd. and ASML Holding NV continue giving the country access to advanced semiconductor technology.】

item.title: 中国人民银行质询更多银行的债券持有量，力图为反弹降温
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国央行开始对银行的债券投资进行新一轮检查，准备为创纪录的反弹降温。【原文：China’s central bank started a fresh round of checks on bond investments at banks as it prepares to cool a record-breaking rally, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第二大养老基金将收购规模较小的澳航竞争对手
item.description: 澳大利亚第二大养老金公司澳大利亚退休信托公司（Australian Retirement Trust）同意与规模较小的竞争对手澳航养老金公司（Qantas Super）合并，这是巨型基金加强对 3.9 万亿澳元（2.6 万亿美元）行业统治的最新迹象。【原文：Australian Retirement Trust, the nation’s second-largest pension, agreed to merge with smaller rival Qantas Super, in the latest sign of mega-funds ramping up their domination of the A$3.9 trillion ($2.6 trillion) industry.】

item.title: 利润率下降后，中国铜冶炼厂计划削减产量
item.description: 由于矿山供应与冶炼能力之间的不平衡继续导致加工利润下降，中国两家铜冶炼厂已制定了明年减产计划。【原文：Two Chinese copper smelters have laid out plans to reduce production next year as an imbalance between mine supply and smelting capacity continues to drive down processing margins.】

item.title: 降息押注推动需求激增，黄金创历史新高
item.description: 由于交易商对美联储今年降息的押注加大，并权衡美国政治前景的不确定性，黄金再创新高。【原文：Gold hit another record as traders placed stronger bets on Federal Reserve rate cuts this year and weighed an uncertain outlook for US politics.】

item.title: 野村调整亚洲投资银行团队，在低迷中裁员
item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc）正在重组其亚洲投资银行团队并裁员，以在中国和香港交易低迷的情况下降低成本。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. is reshuffling its Asia investment-banking team and cutting jobs in an effort to reduce costs amid a deals slump in China and Hong Kong.】

item.title: 方舟公司的伍德说，特斯拉股价将因机器人出租车而暴涨 10 倍
item.description: 方舟投资管理公司（Ark Investment Management LLC）的凯西-伍德（Cathie Wood）认为，特斯拉公司进军利润更高的自动驾驶出租车平台业务，将成为其股价上涨约 10 倍的催化剂。【原文：Tesla Inc.’s move into the more profitable autonomous taxi platform business will be a catalyst for a roughly 10-fold increase in its share price, according to Ark Investment Management LLC’s Cathie Wood.】

item.title: 押注中国宽松政策的交易员推升银行看跌期权
item.description: 投资者对中国银行股今年以来跑赢大盘的涨势越来越持怀疑态度，因为他们担心，为进一步支持中国疲弱的经济而可能采取的宽松措施将损害这些公司的盈利能力。【原文：Investors are increasingly skeptical about this year’s market-beating rally in Chinese bank stocks on concerns that potential easing measures to further support the nation’s flagging economy will hurt the firms’ profitability.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。特朗普谈税收、关税和鲍威尔。华尔街交易员纷纷涌向风险资产。美国大型银行的股票交易逊于预期。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. Trump talks taxes, tariffs and Powell. Wall Street traders rushed to riskier assets. Equity trading crushed estimates at big US banks. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 经典对冲基金交易是中国双速市场的赢家
item.description: 在过去的一年里，中国股市是全球表现最差的股市之一，但根据对冲基金的一种策略，中国股市却战胜了其主要同行。【原文：Chinese stocks have been among the world’s worst performers over the past year, but they are beating their major peers based on one hedge-fund strategy.】

item.title: 预计美国原油库存减少，原油止跌回升
item.description: 石油在连跌三日后企稳，原因是行业估计显示美国原油库存再次下降，消除了人们对中国需求前景黯淡的担忧。【原文：Oil steadied after a three-day drop as an industry estimate pointed to another decline in US crude stockpiles, countering concerns about a lackluster demand outlook in China.】

item.title: 法官称美国巴士公司必须修改拍卖规则
item.description: 美国 Coach 巴士公司的拍卖遇到了障碍，联邦法官驳回了为这家破产的 Megabus 品牌和连接纽约与新泽西的通勤线路所有者提出的融资方案和相关出售建议。【原文：An auction of bus company Coach USA hit a roadblock when a federal judge rejected a financing package and related sale proposal for the bankrupt owner of the Megabus brand and commuter lines connecting New York and New Jersey.】

item.title: 中国不锈钢大亨努力避免第二次倒闭
item.description: 中国金属大亨戴国芳的第一个钢铁帝国因政府遏制市场繁荣的运动、逃税指控和身陷囹圄而垮台。二十年后，他再次为生存而战。【原文：Chinese metal tycoon Dai Guofang’s first steel empire was brought down by a government campaign to rein in market exuberance, tax evasion accusations and a spell behind bars. Two decades on, he’s once again fighting for survival.】

item.title: 股价回升后，国民银行将为 CWB 交易筹集更多资金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，加拿大国民银行正在为其收购加拿大西部银行的计划额外筹资 2000 万加元（1500 万美元）。【原文：National Bank of Canada is raising an additional C$20 million ($15 million) in connection with its planned acquisition of Canadian Western Bank, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 必和必拓铁矿石发货量符合生产指导目标
item.description: 在截至 6 月底的三个月里，全球最大的矿商必和必拓集团（BHP Group Ltd. ）共装运了 6921 万吨铁矿石。【原文：The world’s largest miner BHP Group Ltd. shipped 69.21 million tons of iron ore over the three months to the end of June.】

item.title: 市场综述：亚洲股市加入全球涨势，国债上涨
item.description: 亚洲股市将加入全球股市反弹的行列，因为对美联储将很快开始降息的押注助长了市场中风险较高的股票的抢购热潮。【原文：Asian equities were set to join a global stock rally as bets the Federal Reserve will soon start cutting rates fueled a rush into riskier corners of the market.】

item.title: 中国央行利用对冲基金策略驯服债券牛市
item.description: 中国央行正准备在全球货币政策领域进行一次大胆的新实验；借鉴对冲基金的做法，安排卖空债券。【原文：China’s central bank is readying a bold new experiment in global monetary policy — taking a leaf out of the hedge fund playbook and arranging to short sell bonds.】

item.title: 产量增加，淡水河谷对铁矿石预期充满信心
item.description: 淡水河谷公司（Vale SA）第二季度的铁矿石产量高于预期，原因是其位于巴西北部的最大矿山产量强劲。【原文：Vale SA’s iron ore production in the second quarter was stronger than expected, driven by robust output at its biggest mine in the north of Brazil.】

item.title: 就美国经济计划采访特朗普
item.description:
商界领袖们并不喜欢特朗普的所有政策，但在总统竞选几经波折之后，他在一些出人意料的地方赢得了声援。【原文：

Business leaders don’t love all of Trump’s policies, but after several twists in the presidential campaign, he’s earning vocal support in some surprising quarters.

item.description: 在国债期货和期权市场上，交易商们正大举押注美联储更早、更大幅度的降息。【原文：It’s game on in the Treasuries futures and options markets where traders are piling into bets for earlier, deeper interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚石油公司指责银行和公用事业公司阻碍改革

item.description: 越来越多的华尔街经济学家警告说，美联储在将利率提高到二十年来的最高点后，等待扭转方向的时间太长了。【原文：A growing number of Wall Street economists are cautioning the Federal Reserve is waiting too long to reverse course after raising interest rates to a two-decade high.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉在选举消费狂潮中增加美元供应
item.description: 委内瑞拉政府正在加大美元销售力度，以遏制尼古拉斯-马杜罗的总统竞选开支所带来的通货膨胀效应。【原文：Venezuela’s government is ramping up dollar sales to contain inflationary effects resulting from Nicolás Maduro’s presidential campaign spending.】

item.title: 债券销售激增，投资者需求旺盛
item.description: 由于越来越多的人预期美联储最快将于 9 月份开始降息，发行商们将目光投向了借贷成本降低的前景，市政债券的销售量正以几周来最快的速度激增。【原文：Municipal bond sales are surging at the fastest clip in weeks as issuers focus on the prospect of lower borrowing costs amid growing expectations that the Federal Reserve will start cutting interest rates as soon as September.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体向不知名的、对 SPAC 友好的新泽西基金筹集资金
item.description: 新泽西州一家鲜为人知的专注于为微型和小型公司提供融资的投资管理公司找到了最引人注目的交易：唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体创业公司。【原文：A little-known New Jersey investment manager that focuses on financing micro-cap and small-cap companies has found its most high-profile deal: Donald Trump’s media startup.】
